meanings.definition: A mechanical device used for hoisting or hauling.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen used a winch to lift the heavy anchor from the sea.
meanings.sent2: The winch on the truck helped pull the stuck vehicle out of the mud.
meanings.sent3: The winch decided it was tired of lifting and went on strike!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a winch, pulling her through the toughest times.
meanings.sent5: The winch groaned as it lifted the massive crate to the top of the building.

meanings.definition: To hoist or haul using a winch.
meanings.sent1: They winched the boat onto the trailer after a long day of fishing.
meanings.sent2: He winches up the flag every morning to start the day.
meanings.sent3: The winch whistled a tune as it pulled the car up the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: She winched her spirits up and faced the challenge with a smile.
meanings.sent5: The winch slowly winched the heavy load to the top of the tower.
